definition: to give oneself leeway (idiom)/to allow room for error
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to build up the country through thrift and hard work (idiom)
to run an enterprise diligently and thriftily
every drop returns to the public good (idiom); not one penny is misused
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
storing grain against a famine/to lay sth by for a rainy day/also written 積穀防飢|积谷防饥
water that is too clear has no fish, and one who is too severe has no friends (idiom)
pinyin: shui3 zhi4 qing1 ze2 wu2 yu2 , ren2 zhi4 cha2 ze2 wu2 tu2
related.word: 水至清则无鱼，人至察则无徒

definition: to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
